intro: Leucopogon gnidium, commonly known as the narrowleaf heath, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, and it thrives in acidic, well-drained soils. Leucopogon gnidium is often found in coastal dunes and sandy soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
